# Bonus: more plots with {ggplot2}

## Histograms and density plots

### Histogram

```{r}
ggplot(geneexp2, aes(x=expression, color=sample)) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(y=after_stat(density)), fill="white") +
  theme_classic()
```

### Density plot

```{r}
ggplot(geneexp2, aes(x=expression, color=sample)) + 
  theme_classic() +
  geom_density(alpha=.2, fill="#FF6666") 
```

### Histogram + density

```{r}
ggplot(geneexp2, aes(x=expression, color=sample)) + 
  geom_histogram(aes(y=after_stat(density)), fill="white") +
  theme_classic() +
  geom_density(alpha=.2, fill="#FF6666") 
```


## Pie chart

We will plot a pie chart representing the number of genes from **gtf** found in each chromosome.

Prepare data so as to obtain counts:

```{r}
gtf_count_chr <- gtf %>%
  group_by(chr) %>%
  summarise(counts=n())
```

```{r}
ggplot(data=gtf_count_chr, mapping=aes(x="", y=counts, fill=chr)) + 
  geom_bar(stat="identity", width=1) +
  coord_polar("y", start=0) +
  theme_void()
```
